page.title: 01Pendomer and Halstock
page.content:
This block includes the hamlet of Pendomer, in Somerset, and part of Halstock which is in Dorset, although its postal address is Somerset. The county boundary crosses the block from east to west. The main Waterloo to Penzance railway line runs across the north-west corner of the block, forming something of a barrier between Pendomer and the rest of the area.
Apart from the two villages, settlement consists mainly of scattered farms. Indeed, the predominant land use is farming, mostly dairy or mixed, though there is some forestry. A large portion of Sutton Bingham reservoir occupies part of the eastern half of the block. Most of the roads run from north to south. There is no industrial development of any kind.
